page.title: 03A child's life in Hazelton.
page.content: During the summer evenings Caroline does her piano practice,and if its hot she sometimes has a water fight with freezer bags filled with water. She also watches television. Sometimes Caroline helps out at a friends guesthouse serving the customers. For pocket money she and her friend cut lawns and are paid approximately two or three pounds. She also goes sailing in the family boat at South Cerney. There is no special playground for young children in Hazelton but sometimes she and her friends play around the village roads on their bicycles. There are approxiamtely 100 people living in Hazelton,but there are no shops, school or post office.Caroline says "I prefer to live in the country because its quiet and pretty".
